# messages

## <ApiType type="Attribute" slug="jsonable" symbolName="Jsonable" /> Jsonable

**Type:** <TypeLink type={{"type_str": "TypeAlias", "description": null, "kind": "simple", "symbol_name": "TypeAlias", "doc_url": null}} />

Simple type alias for JSON-serializable types.


## <ApiType type="Class" slug="jsonable-object" symbolName="JsonableObject" /> JsonableObject

Protocol for JSON-serializable objects.

This protocol defines the interface for objects that can be serialized to
JSON. It is used to annotate the `JsonableType` type alias.

**Bases:** 
<TypeLink type={{"type_str": "Protocol", "description": null, "kind": "simple", "symbol_name": "Protocol", "doc_url": "https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html#typing.Protocol"}} />

## <ApiType type="Class" slug="message" symbolName="Message" /> Message

A message in an LLM interaction.

Messages have a role (system, user, or assistant) and content that can be
a simple string or a complex array of content parts. The content can include
text, images, audio, documents, and tool interactions.

For most use cases, prefer the convenience functions system(), user(), and
assistant() instead of directly creating Message objects.

Example:

    ```python
    from mirascope import llm

    messages = [
        llm.messages.system("You are a helpful assistant."),
        llm.messages.user("Hello, how are you?"),
    ]
    ```
